Which Year Is Today?

Today’s Requirements

  • High availability
  • Scalability
  • Fault tolerance
  • Self-healing
  • Self-adaptation
  • Full Automation

Before

  • Mutable: unreliable, not replicable
  • Static: not healable, not available, not fault tolerant, expensive
  • Manual: unreliable, slow, undocumented

Today

  • Immutable
  • Dynamic
  • Automated

What Does That Mean?

  • VMs instead bare metal
  • Images instead runtime provisioning
  • Container images instead RPM/DEB/JAR/WAR/…
  • Schedulers instead CM
  • Service discovery instead fixed addresses
  • Stateless when possible
  • State replication or network drives

Containers vs

Schedulers vs

The Future

  • Containers are the past
  • Schedulers are the present
  • Unikernels and serverless are the future
